basics.name: Michelle Rasavong
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2026.

skills.name: Frameworks and Libraries
keywords: Node.js, React, Redux, jQuery, Bootstrap, JUnit

skills.name: Developer Tools
keywords: Git, Linux, Docker, Visual Studio Code, IntelliJ, PyCharm, Eclipse, VirtualBox

work.summary: Contribute to the development and maintenance of the Hawai‘i Climate Data Portal (HCDP) as a member of the cyberinfrastructure software development team.
highlights: Implement the Hawai‘i Mesonet, a user-friendly live data access tool integrated into the HCDP platform
Visualize data for current weather conditions and elevation levels from an extensive network of approximately one hundred telemetered stations
Identify, communicate, and mitigate potential setbacks in collaboration with campus cyberinfrastructure and network operators

work.summary: Supported, managed, and administered licenses for software and application services.
highlights: Assisted in installing and upgrading various system software and related utilities including Microsoft and Adobe products, statistical analysis software, and cloud storage services
Diagnosed and resolved technical issues with hardware, peripherals, network connections, and external software on Windows and macOS devices

work.summary: Handled customer service including sales, transactions, and inventory management.
highlights: Worked collaboratively with a team of other sales associates to exceed monthly, quarterly, and yearly sales goals
Maintained extensive knowledge about the latest products and upcoming releases to assist customers effectively

volunteer.organization: Supporting Women in Information Technology and Computing in Hawaii (SWITCH)
volunteer.summary: A STEM organization whose purpose is to support women and minorities, promote gender and racial equality, and foster professional growth for students in Information and Computer Sciences.
Participated in a student-led, extracurricular organization focused on real-world training for cyber defense.

awards.title: UH Manoa Dean's List
awards.awarder: UH Manoa Office of the Registrar
awards.summary: Awarded to full-time undergraduate students who earned a semester GPA of 3.5 or higher without any NC (no credit), W (withdrawn), I (incomplete), or F (failure) grades.
